page.title: 06THE GREEN VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall at The Green serves the parish of Thwaites. The hall is about 40 years old. It is used regularly about ten times a week for Brownies, Cubs and other things. The best attended activity is the WI meeting. A committee run the Village Hall and employ a caretaker. It can be hired for various functions. Hiring costs are more if you live outside the parish. The hall has a well equiped kitchen. There is a main hall,a supper room, a snooker and reading room, and toilets. As well as the weekly events the hall is also used less regularly for dances and coffee mornings. There are also annual events. Our survey showed that the best two attended were the Gala (64% of those families who replied) and The Sports (45%). some other annual events are The Christmas & Halloween Parties & a New Year Dance
